item.title: Form Overview
item.description: What are forms? Forms allow us to get data from users How do forms work? Form Structure <form action="http://www.example.com/subscribe.php" method="get"> <p>This is where the form controls will appear.</p> </form> Form Attributes action: Required, the url on the server that will receive the information from the form method: Either a get or post Use get when the data being sent to server is not senstive information and is relatively small (search form) Use post when sending senstive data and when sending large amounts of data (registration form)

item.title: Form Elements
item.description: Text Input <form action="http://www.example.com/login.php"> <p> Username: <input type="text" name="username" maxlength="30" /> </p> </form> Text Input Example Text Input Attributes type=“text”: Tells browser input will store plain text name: Used by the server to identify which form control that data came from maxlength: (optional) Specifies that max number of characters that can be entered Password Input <form action="http://www.example.com/login.php"> <p> Username: <input type="text" name="username" size="15" maxlength="30" /> </p> <p> Password: <input type="password" name="password" size="15" maxlength="30" /> </p> </form> Password Input Example Password Input Attributes type=“password”: Tells browser input will store sensitive information, block characters from being displayed name: Used by the server to identify which form control that data came from maxlength: (optional) Specifies that max number of characters that can be entered Text Area <form action="http://www.
